title: BDD Acceptance Criteria Specification
description: The complete and authoritative source of truth for platform behavior, governed by strict BDD-style acceptance criteria.
specificationGuidelines: Complete and authoritative source of truth.
No undocumented behavior, architecture, UX, or technical assumptions.
Only explicitly specified behaviors and failure modes should be implemented.
Observable behavior must exactly satisfy the criteria (technology-agnostic).

feature.title: Feature Name
feature.description: High-level name of the feature or behavior being specified.

test_coverage_percentage.title: Test Coverage Percentage
test_coverage_percentage.description: The percentage of the codebase covered by automated tests.

scenarios.title: Acceptance Scenarios
scenarios.description: A list of authoritative scenarios that define the complete observable behavior.

given.statement: I am on the home page
I see the 'Welcome to the Minimal Application' branding

when.statement: I click 'Sign In' and then 'Sign Up'
I enter my username, email, and password

then.statement: I should see my username in the user menu

given.statement: I am on the home page

when.statement: I sign in with my email and password
I open the user menu and click 'Sign Out'

then.statement: The 'Sign In' button should be visible again
The branding and call to action are clearly visible

scenario.title: Behavioral Scenario
scenario.description: A single observable behavior defined by conditions, triggers, and outcomes.

name.title: Scenario Name
name.description: Descriptive name of the success or failure scenario.

given.title: Givens
given.description: Initial conditions and preconditions required for the scenario.

when.title: Thens
when.description: Events and actions that trigger the scenario.

then.title: Thens
then.description: Expected outcomes and observable changes in system state.

clause.title: Behavioral Clause
clause.description: A single atomic statement forming part of a BDD scenario.

type.title: Clause Type
type.description: The logic role of the clause in the BDD structure.

statement.title: Clause Statement
statement.description: The descriptive content of the behavior or condition.
